abstract: The main objective of this paper is to introduce a new more elegant notion of leftâ€“right (p,q)\documentclass[12pt]{minimal} \usepackage{amsmath} \usepackage{wasysym} \usepackage{amsfonts} \usepackage{amssymb} \usepackage{amsbsy} \usepackage{mathrsfs} \usepackage{upgreek} \setlength{\oddsidemargin}{-69pt} \begin{document}$(p,q)$\end{document}-derivative and definite integrals. To show the significance of these concepts, we discuss some of their basic properties. A new generalized (p,q)\documentclass[12pt]{minimal} \usepackage{amsmath} \usepackage{wasysym} \usepackage{amsfonts} \usepackage{amssymb} \usepackage{amsbsy} \usepackage{mathrsfs} \usepackage{upgreek} \setlength{\oddsidemargin}{-69pt} \begin{document}$(p,q)$\end{document}-integral identity is also obtained. Utilizing this identity as an auxiliary result we then obtain our main results using the concept of n-polynomial convex functions.
